creator: dietmar.mueller@eurotours.at
text: at http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/generic_howto/workers.html the socket_keepalive config value is sometimes in the sample config 1 and sometimes true.

OK, docs don't tell it but:

The values 1, "on" (any case) and any string starting with 't' or 'y' (any case) evaluate to the same.

Similarly 0, "off", and any string starting with 'f' or 'n' (any) case evaluate the same.

I'll keep the bug open until we have improved the docs (consistency and allowed boolean "values"). Doc path welcome.
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
I added an explanation to the workers doc and to the iis doc, explaining the various possible syntaxes for boolean properties. In the docs (examples, explanations, defaults) I standardized now on "true" and "false", because that's what most people actually use in their configs.

Committed by 1647362, will be part of version 1.2.41.
